metadata.Title: CVE-2019-19920 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
sa-exim 4.2.1 allows attackers to execute arbitrary code if they can write a .cf file or a rule. This occurs because Greylisting.pm relies on eval (rather than direct parsing and/or use of the taint feature). This issue is similar to CVE-2018-11805.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2019-19920` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

sa-exim - 4.2.1-19
No subscription required

criterions.comment: sa-exim package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.2.1-19').
